text: Mark Murphy (March 14, 1932 - October 22, 2015) was an American jazz singer. He was born in Syracuse, New York, but spent most of his life in New Jersey. He was won the 1996, 1997, 2000, and 2001 Down Beat magazine readers jazz poll for Best Male Vocalist of the Year. During his career, he had six Grammy award nominations for Best Vocal Jazz Performance. He was also known for his original lyrics to the jazz classics "Stolen Moments" and "Red Clay". Murphy died on October 22, 2015 in Englewood, New Jersey, aged 83.Legendary jazz vocalist Mark Murphy dies aged 83 ==References== ==Other websites== *About Jazz Category:1932 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American jazz singers Category:American jazz musicians Category:Singers from New York (state) Category:Musicians from New York (state) Category:Singers from New Jersey Category:Musicians from New Jersey Category:People from Syracuse, New York
title: Mark Murphy
